rename.from: confusion on golang GOOS name in goreleaser release
rename.to: goreleaser releases doesn't match the goreleaser.yaml file ?

body:
The names are currently taken from `uname`.  I guess the idea here is to have more human-readable names than the default goos/goarch values.
> By default, `replacements` replace GOOS and GOARCH values with valid outputs
 of `uname -s` and `uname -m` respectively

But as you're pointing out the current defaults might not be the best naming either.

At the moment I always have a `replacements` section to change the naming.
Ideally we would find defaults a majority of the users are happy with. 
Especially when automating the download of multiple Go-based binaries it would nice if they have a common naming pattern.

What do you think, we come up with a better default naming pattern?
cc @caarlos0, @client9 @bep 


Here are the naming patterns from some projects in comparison:

[GoReleaser](https://github.com/goreleaser/goreleaser/releases/tag/v0.18.0) | [Hugo](https://github.com/spf13/hugo/releases/tag/v0.20.7) | [sleepto](https://github.com/qvl/sleepto/releases/tag/v1.7)
------------ | ------------- | -------------
x_Darwin_i386.tar.gz | x_2.7.13_macOS-32bit.tar.gz | x_2.7.13_mac_32bit.tar.gz
x_Darwin_x86_64.tar.gz | x_2.7.13_macOS-64bit.tar.gz | x_2.7.13_mac_64bit.tar.gz
x_Linux_arm64.tar.gz | x_2.7.13_Linux-ARM64.tar.gz | x_2.7.13_linux_ARM64.tar.gz
x_Linux_armv6.tar.gz | x_2.7.13_Linux-ARM.tar.gz | x_2.7.13_linux_ARM.tar.gz
x_Linux_i386.tar.gz | x_2.7.13_Linux-64bit.tar.gz | x_2.7.13_linux_64bit.tar.gz
x_Linux_x86_64.tar.gz | x_2.7.13_Linux-32bit.tar.gz | x_2.7.13_linux_32bit.tar.gz
x_Windows_i386.zip | x_2.7.13_Windows-32bit.zip | x_2.7.13_windows_32bit.zip
x_Windows_x86_64.zip  | x_2.7.13_Windows-64bit.zip | x_2.7.13_windows_64bit.zip

Yeah, the idea of defaulting to `uname` values is that you can `curl https://blah/myapp_$(uname -s)_$(uname -m).tar.gz` or something, like it is done [here](https://github.com/goreleaser/get/blob/master/get#L24).

Maybe the defaults are not ideal though.. we can discuss and change, of course :)

Hi guys, totally get uname concept and get discussion!  From that it led me to understand the bug better.   I'll comment on defaults separately.

I think the "bug" (feature?) I bumped into is this:

If you *do not* use any archive/replacements, everything defaults to uname values.  That's what goreleaser is doing.  All good.

If you add *one* entry to archive/replacements, everything defaults to GOOS values.  Even for things you didn't specify.   

Here's my experiment:

https://github.com/client9/misspell/blob/master/goreleaser.yml

```yaml
# goreleaser.yml

build:
  main: cmd/misspell/main.go
  binary: misspell
  goos:
    - darwin
    - linux
  goarch:
    - amd64
  env:
    - CGO_ENABLED=0
  ignore:
    - goos: darwin
      goarch: 386

archive:
  name_template: "{{.Binary}}_{{.Version}}_{{.Os}}_{{.Arch}}"

  replacements:
    amd64: 64-bit
    386: 32-bit
    darwin: macOS

snapshot:
  name_template: SNAPSHOT-{{.Commit}}
```

Notice how I'm *not* specifying anything for `linux` in the `replacements` section.

but Yet...  here are my releases:   GOOS `linux` lower case.

a62640e4122a033cf4098d2de41dc335a8ad708b668ed41ac9a1304848fb8f57  misspell_0.1.0_linux_64-bit.tar.gz
5189df7b59e54a8439324eab7da6cbd708ca724b287c432dc950788de384cfb5  misspell_0.1.0_macOS_64-bit.tar.gz

That doesn't seem right.  If you want to change one default, you really have to change defaults for every possible value.

I thin hugo bumped into this which is why their replacements sections is huge.

yeah, this looks broken, but is intended.

It would be OK if the defaults were always the goos/goarch/etc names... maybe we should remove the default replacements..

rename.from: goreleaser releases doesn't match the goreleaser.yaml file ?
rename.to: behavior of archive naming with and without archive.replacements sections

body: changed name to better reflect the discussion, since it's not a bug.
OK, I agree with defaulting to go values.

issue.title: breaking: do not default to uname values

body:
Not related to the replacements, we could think about changing the default name template to include the version:
`name_template: "{{.Binary}}_{{.Version}}_{{.Os}}_{{.Arch}}"`

What do you think @caarlos0 @client9 ?
@jorinvo Adding version is the first thing I do when setting up a new project.
